q: Don't worry about being successful, but work toward being significant and the success will naturally follow.
h:
“Don't worry about being successful, but work toward being significant and the success will naturally follow.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job and not be paid for it.
h:
“You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job and not be paid for it.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
h:
“There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.” —
Colin Powell

q: Your chances of success in any undertaking can always be measured by your belief in yourself.
h:
“Your chances of success in any undertaking can always be measured by your belief in yourself.” —
Robert Collier

q: If you set your goals ridiculously high and its a failure, you will fail above everyone elses success.
h:
“If you set your goals ridiculously high and its a failure, you will fail above everyone elses success.” —
James Cameron

q: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
h:
“Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Success is often achieved by those who don't know that failure is inevitable.
h:
“Success is often achieved by those who don't know that failure is inevitable.” —
Coco Chanel

q: The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.
h:
“The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Everyone can rise above their circumstances and achieve success if they are dedicated to and passionate about what they do.
h:
“Everyone can rise above their circumstances and achieve success if they are dedicated to and passionate about what they do.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: I believe that potential is unlimited - success depends on daring to act on dreams.
h:
“I believe that potential is unlimited - success depends on daring to act on dreams. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: Success and failure come and go, but don't let them define you. It's who you are that matters.
h:
“Success and failure come and go, but don't let them define you. It's who you are that matters.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Success is about creating value.
h:
“Success is about creating value.” —
Candice Carpenter

q: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
h:
“Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.” —
Maya Angelou

q: Success is going from failure to failure without losing your enthusiasm
h:
“Success is going from failure to failure without losing your enthusiasm” —
Winston Churchill

q: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
h:
“Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.” —
Robert Collier

q: Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.
h:
“Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.
h:
“Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
h:
“Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Confidence is not a guarantee of success, but a pattern of thinking that will improve your likelihood of success, a tenacious search for ways to make things work.
h:
“Confidence is not a guarantee of success, but a pattern of thinking that will improve your likelihood of success, a tenacious search for ways to make things work.” —
John Eliot

q: The key to success is action.
h:
“The key to success is action.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
h:
“Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.
h:
“The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.” —
James Allen

q: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
h:
“Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.
h:
“Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: The way of success is the way of continuous pursuit of knowledge.
h:
“The way of success is the way of continuous pursuit of knowledge.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Enthusiasm is a vital element toward the individual success of every man or woman.
h:
“Enthusiasm is a vital element toward the individual success of every man or woman.” —
Conrad Hilton

q: Success is an iceberg.
h:
“Success is an iceberg.” —
Unknown

q: That some achieve great success is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.
h:
“That some achieve great success is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: The biggest challenge after success is shutting up about it.
h:
“The biggest challenge after success is shutting up about it.” —
Criss Jami

q: Success comes to those who become success conscious.
h:
“Success comes to those who become success conscious.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
h:
“The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.” —
Colin R. Davis

q: The four P's to success are pressure, persistence, perseverance, and prayer.
h:
“The four P's to success are pressure, persistence, perseverance, and prayer.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
h:
“Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: You already have every characteristic necessary for success if you recognize, claim, develop and use them.
h:
“You already have every characteristic necessary for success if you recognize, claim, develop and use them.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: If you want to be successful, you have to jump, there's no way around it.
h:
“If you want to be successful, you have to jump, there's no way around it.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.
h:
“Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Projecting your mind into a successful situation is the most powerful means to achieve goals.
h:
“Projecting your mind into a successful situation is the most powerful means to achieve goals. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.
h:
“Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.” —
Gary Keller

q: Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
h:
“Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: This is the most simple and basic component of life: our struggles determine our successes.
h:
“This is the most simple and basic component of life: our struggles determine our successes.” —
Mark Manson

q: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
h:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.” —
Bette Midler

q: Failure is the highway to success.
h:
“Failure is the highway to success.” —
Og Mandino

q: Success is not the result of making money; making money is the result of success - and success is in direct proportion to our service.
h:
“Success is not the result of making money; making money is the result of success - and success is in direct proportion to our service.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Most people achieved their greatest success one step beyond what looked like their greatest failure.
h:
“Most people achieved their greatest success one step beyond what looked like their greatest failure.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Failure means you've now learned another valuable lesson that pushes you one step closer to success.
h:
“Failure means you've now learned another valuable lesson that pushes you one step closer to success.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
h:
“Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.” —
John Wooden

q: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
h:
“Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, 'What's in it for me?'
h:
“Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, 'What's in it for me?'” —
Brian Tracy

q: The road to success is always under construction..
h:
“The road to success is always under construction..” —
Lily Tomlin
